bibl.title: Letter from Blossom Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, August 30, 1950

div1.p: Blossom Reed describes her financial troubles and considers selling her mother's paintings in order to keep her home. She alludes to writings of her mother's that would be of interest to Hench.

div1.head: Letter from Blossom Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, August 30, 1950
div1.p:
I do so appreciate all
of the beautiful sympathy at
the passing of my beloved Mother-
I loved her I think, as you
losed your beloved Mother too-
Please accept my deepest thanks
toyou and your dear wife.
Indeed I thought of you as
I stood by the graves of my
dear ones- God was so good
in giving what He has now
taken away- I like to say,
with smiling lips- Thy Will Be Done-
You and I have talked over
the question of money, in the
exchange of the gift of love-
but tho love rules the world
money does also- Mother and
I gave all we could, in giving
free all the data etc- of my
beloved father. These thank God
is in your safe keeping-
I have in my possesion right
here in my home- writings of
Mother's I know “you would
eat up!” I am writing in
haste in bed for tho I am
well- I get tried out all too
Soon- answer- a sprained
ankle- If you could come
to see myme I think I could
give you many beautiful
books of Mother's paintings that
were asked for just after
fathers death, from the Dept'
of agriculture- and letter that
acwas sent at same time-
The Story of my Indian Nurse
She dedicated that to father
all done so beautifully-
Many more stories dear in
my heart- Things too dear
to sell- but in order to
keep my home here I love
so very dearly, I must have
money to do so- I owe a
mortage of 3500-I have to
borrow 500 to pay the painter
and it took all of the
1000 you sent me because
it took so much more to
live on it has all gone-
That was my “nest egg”
my “nest egg” now is about $84.00
If I could sell Mother's paintings etc-
I could keep my home-
but one can not live on
$84.00 a year can they - Thats
all I have now to live on-
I never heard a word from
the Chase Nat- Bank in New York-
Trust Dept- 11 - Broad St- and
so I think the help I am
asking for will come
through you- that means
doctors- I dare write no
more but I beleive and Know
you understand- My dear
love to you my wonderful
friend and all you love
and hold most dear-

closer.seg:
P. S- Please excuse
all mistakes! writing in bed
is not an easy one-
I wish I could see you
and your dear wife
again- The time you
were here on your
way to Mercersburg-
Remember? and now we
all have a job to do in
this fearful time- May
God grant us peace
of Soul and Mind as
only He Can do through
His beloved Son- Our Lord Jesus
B. R.
